subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Need common abbreviation list
msgSnippet: Junior. I m going to deemphasize connections between letters beyond a small number of ligatures. There are several things I want from a new font: regular,
messageBody:
Junior. I'm going to deemphasize connections between letters beyond a
small number of ligatures. There are several things I want from a new
font: regular, bold, italic, bold italic; both serif and sans serif
typefaces, etc. A strong desire to change the keyboard mapping was one
of the original motivators for me, actually.

I like the examples for Shavian from Kingsley Read that are in the
document Moira recently uploaded. (Thanks, Moira!) Right now I'm
reading "Designing Type" by Karen Cheng, sketching ideas by hand, and
fiddling around with FontForge a bit. I'm a scientist, not an artist,
so don't expect anything of beauty any time soon.

Ted


On Nov 19, 2007 2:00 PM, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Ted Larson Freeman wrote:
> >
> >
> > Excellent. Thank you. This is exactly I wanted--an ASCII letter
> > assignment for each QS letter that was grounded in modern linguistic
> > notation.
> >
> > I'm designing a new font for QS. (I haven't mentioned it until now
> > because my progress is quite slow. I can't keep up with Paul.) One of
> > the issues I've faced is whether to use the same keyboard assignments
> > as existing fonts. Until now I was just planning to change assignments
> > for #20, #41-44, the name dot and angled brackets, but now I'm going
> > to use this list.
> >
>
> Are you developing a Junior or a Senior font?
>
> Paul
>
